results.name: Triangular array A065547 unsigned and transposed.
reference: Louis Comtet, Analyse Combinatoire, PUF, 1970, Tome 2, pp. 98-99.
link: J. M. Hammersley, An undergraduate exercise in manipulation, Math. Scientist, 14 (1989), 1-23. (Annotated scanned copy)
J. M. Hammersley, An undergraduate exercise in manipulation, Math. Scientist, 14 (1989), 1-23.
formula: Equals A000035 DELTA [0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, 20, 25, 30, ...], where DELTA is Deléham's operator defined in A084938.
T(n,n-1) = A110501(n), Genocchi numbers of first kind of even index. - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 16 2007
mathematica: h[n_, x_] := Sum[c[k]*x^k, {k, 0, n}]; eq[n_] := SolveAlways[h[n, x*(x-1)] == EulerE[2*n, x], x]; row[n_] := Table[c[k], {k, 0, n}] /. eq[n] // First // Abs // Reverse; Table[row[n], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 02 2013 *)
xref: Row sums sum(k>=0, T(n, k)) = A006846(n), values of Hammersley's polynomial p_n(1).
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Jul 19 2003
